item.title: Avoiding useEffect for fetching in React 18: A use-case for useSyncExternalStore and Observables
item.description: This blog will show you how I avoided double useEffect fetches in React 18 by migrating a library to use useSyncExternalStore and observables.

item.title: A billion dollar mindset toward breaks.
item.description: Sitting at my desk I had an overwhelming feeling doing to much but also getting nothing done.

item.title: Effortlessly Debug Your Chrome Extension with React Devtools
item.description: Are you tired of struggling to debug your React Chrome extension? Learn how to use React devtools to make the process effortless. From installing the standalone version to injecting it into your content script, this guide covers everything you need to know to optimize your extension's performance and squash bugs like a pro. Get ready to revolutionize your debugging process and take your extension to the next level.

item.title: Compass of Narvil
item.description: Finding the directions to grief.

item.title: From the West Coast to the Heartland
item.description: Take a journey with me as I road trip across America in a Tesla Model 3 electric car. Along the way, I'll share my experiences with charging infrastructure and the practicalities of driving an EV on a long-distance trip. Find out what it's like to travel in a Tesla Model 3, and see why electric vehicles are the way of the future.

item.title: Native NodeJS Apps
item.description: Native NodeJS apps are a relatively new breed of apps coming out of the NodeJS community that combine NodeJS and Webkit. Ill be going over : what are the options out there, what kind of things can these apps do compared to webapps, what are the current pro/cons of making a NodeJS native app, and more.
